text_section1.text: There was warmth and movement... something alive in that...
Baldwin! Larry Baldwin!! -- I want to see you -- now!
Yes, sir, Mister Dugan! Ah, I see you've read the lastest article in my travel series --

text_section2.text: Travel, he calls it! To where? You think I could ever print this drivel? I pay you to read copy, Baldwin! Your job is to check commas -- periods -- spelling! That's been your job for thirty years on this paper!

text_section1.text: Thirty years, Baldwin! You used to be a good copy reader -- alert, dependable, precise! But since you got this crazy travel notion, our news has been one big jumble -- what with all your errors!
Listen to this -- `my journeys took me to a tropical land, fragrant and lush with violet grass and giant pink foliage!' Baldwin, I've warned you for the last time -- I've had it!
You mean I'm fired, Mr. Dugan? After all these years?

text_section2.text: You brought it on yourself Baldwin!

text_section1.text: What does a man do? Where does he go -- after thirty years at a job?

text_section2.text: You can always take a trip, Baldwin! Why not settle down in that crazy land you're always writing about -- Ha! Ha! Ha!

text_section1.text: What made you do it, anyway? What possessed you to keep writing that drivel?

text_section2.text: It's not drivel! I've seen these places, I tell you -- as clearly as I see you now! I see it in my dreams -- in my subconscious -- and somehow, I know it exists!

text_section1.text: Ha Ha Ha Ha Ha Ha Ha

It was a bad time to be unemployed. Winter was in its full fury -- and a man of Harry's age had to conserve his meager savings. Harry had to find a new rooming house, where the rent would be cheap -- very cheap!
Some strange, compelling force guided Harry's old legs, leading him to a rickety tenement house -- He knocked on the door, fearfully -- almost expecting to be greeted by a familiar face --

text_section2.text: Well? What are you selling, old man?

text_section3.text: Uh -- I was wondering if you had a room for rent --

text_section1.text: I have one vacancy -- in the basement -- four bucks a week in advance. Come in, come in!
Don't stumble, old man!
It's not very inviting! The window's cracked and there's ice on the doorstep --

text_section2.text: It ain't the Ritz -- but it's cheap! Do you want it, or don't you?

text_section1.text: Harry stayed -- he was much too tired to travel further. He dropped exhausted onto the hard cot, wrapping his scarf snugly around his neck --

In his sleep, a warm gust of air carressed the old man's cheek. He awoke with a start -- he was perspiring freely under his heavy clothing. At first Harry thought he was feverish, but after removing his coat, he felt comfortable, rested -- almost young!

text_section2.text: Why, I haven't felt so spry in years! I believe I'll step out for a bite of dinner --

text_section1.text: So you're the new tenant! You'd best button up, mister, before you freeze to death!

text_section2.text: If our miserly landlady doesn't stop economizing on the steam heat, we'll all freeze solid!

text_section1.text: Why, I hadn't noticed! -- I feel quite --

text_section2.text: You feel nothing, friend, if you don't feel this cold! Your senses must be numbed by age, old man!

text_section1.text: Harry was puzzled. He returned to his room. It was warm, dry. He felt the pipes -- they were ice cold! The room should have been frigid!

text_section2.text: The heat must be coming from somewhere in this room -- but where? How? I've got to find the source!

text_section1.text: No --
Not here --
Or here --
The picture -- the picture on the wall -- it's warm! What's behind it?
A hole -- just a hole in the wall!
It was just a hole in the wall -- dark and deep -- an opening to nowhere! -- But from it issued a fragrant, almost tropical warmth! Harry was mystified --

text_section2.text: Perhaps if I try an experiment --

text_section1.text: Harry decided to throw an object into the hole, listen for the sound when it dropped. First it was a pencil, then a bottle, a shoe ---
There was only silence! -- Harry waited -- and waited -- and waited --
Finally --
What are these objects? I've never seen the likes of them before!

Harry thought for long moments -- he had to find out what was on the other side of that wall! He summoned up his courage and cautiously probed the inky depths with his hand. He felt the touch of foliage -- silky grass --
Why not, Harry Baldwin -- you're an old man with your life almost over, and not much to look forward to on this Earth!
The city seemed to swallow up Harry Baldwin -- although the police combed the area for a trace to his whereabouts, their search was fruitless ---
Listen to this travel article, Dugan -- by old Harry Baldwin -- remember him? `I have finally found the gateway to this beautiful, sunny world in another dimension...'

I have found a utopian city like nothing ever seen on Earth... The people are friendly and have welcomed me with gifts of rare stones and exotic fruits. I like the place so well, I intend to settle down here...

text_section3.text: It is your home now -- you must live among us!

text_section1.text: Poor old Harry! It's been three years now since he's been reported dead. I thought I'd throw out all those crazy manuscripts of his -- where did you dig up that one -- in his desk drawer?

text_section2.text: Desk? We got rid of his desk last year!

text_section3.text: The manuscript came in the mail -- this morning!
